entity.description: The Enterprise Risk Management Framework (ERMF) governs the way in which Absa identifies and manages its risks. entity.description: The Potential Future Exposure (PFE) is the maximum expected credit exposure over a specified period of time calculated at some level of confidence (i.e. at a given quantile). PFE is a measure of counterparty risk/credit risk. It can also be defined as the risk-adjusted number calculated as each trade is run through the relevant calculation system.
entity.label: Term
entity.name: Potential Future Exposure (PFE) ARO

properties.value: The Potential Future Exposure (PFE) is the maximum expected credit exposure over a specified period of time calculated at some level of confidence (i.e. at a given quantile). PFE is a measure of counterparty risk/credit risk. It can also be defined as the risk-adjusted number calculated as each trade is run through the relevant calculation system.
Finance disclosure hierarchy (includes legal entity, BU, sub-BU roll-ups); B2 Asset Class; Industry; Geography; Customer Group; Defaulted; WL category; M&S; DG; IRB; Std

The measure is currently calculated using a Monte Carlo Simulation-based approach. Underlying market variables is simulated over the life of the portfolio to calculate the maximum future market value taking into account potential margin calls. The simulations projecting the maximum value are accurate to a pre-determined confidence level (98% is used currently).

Join Condition -
select a.XMSK081_BAL_OUTSTANDING 
, a.XMSK081_INSTAL_STATUS    
, a1.XMBMETQ_JRNL_OUTST_BAL  
, b.XMSK086_TOTAL_LOAN_GRANT 
, b.XMSK086_LOAN_TYPE  
, c.XMSK087_HOLD_CODE  
from XMSK081  a 
left join XMBMETQ   a1 
on a.XMSK081_ACCOUNT_NUMBER = a1.ACCOUNT_NBR
left join XMSK086  b
on a.XMSK081_ACCOUNT_NUMBER = b.XMSK081_ACCOUNT_NUMBER5 
left join XMSK087  c 
on a.XMSK081_ACCOUNT_NUMBER = c.XMSK081_ACCOUNT_NUMBER6 
Transformation 1 - 
If XMSK081_BAL_OUTSTANDING  != NULL then XMSK081_BAL_OUTSTANDING  
else JRNL_OUTST_BAL as Month End Balance
from XMSK081 a 
left join XMBMETQ b 
on a.XMSK081_ACCOUNT_NUMBER = b.ACCOUNT_NBR  
Transformation 2 - 
 if XMSK087_HOLD_CODE  not in (261,262,263,264,265) then FACILITY_LIMIT_AMT=MAX(Month End Balance,0); 
else if XMSK087_HOLD_CODE in (261,262,263) then FACILITY_LIMIT_AMT=MAX(Month End Balance,XMSK086_TOTAL_LOAN_GRANT);
else if XMSK087_HOLD_CODE in (264,265) and XMSK081_INSTAL_STATUS>0 then FACILITY_LIMIT_AMT=SUM(Month End Balance,XMSK081_INSTAL_STATUS); 
else if XMSK087_HOLD_CODE  in (264,265) and XMSK081_INSTAL_STATUS<=0 then FACILITY_LIMIT_AMT=MAX(Month End Balance,0);
If XMSK086_LOAN_TYPE  in ('DEV','FAD','B','FAB') then FACILITY_LIMIT_AMT=XMSK086_TOTAL_LOAN_GRANT

entity.description: Arises from the failure of an obligor to meet their payment obligations under a derivative or securities financing agreement. This includes failure to pay a regular cash flow, make a specific payment, or deliver an asset. entity.description: A measure of the maximum replacement value of a derivative or securities financing portfolio at a given confidence level (98%) over the portfolio's life time (unsecured portfolios) or the closeout period (collateralized portfolios).
entity.label: Term
entity.name: Potential Future Exposure

properties.value: A measure of the maximum replacement value of a derivative or securities financing portfolio at a given confidence level (98%) over the portfolio's life time (unsecured portfolios) or the closeout period (collateralized portfolios).

The measure is currently calculated using a Monte Carlo Simulation-based approach. Underlying market variables are simulated over the life of the portfolio to calculate the maximum future market value taking into account potential margin calls. The simulations projecting the maximum value are accurate to a pre-determined confidence level (98% is used currently).

CVA = 2.33 x √[h x √(A - B)2 + C] 

h - is the one-year risk horizon, in units of a year, h = 1.
A = ∑i 0.5 * wi * (Mi * EADitotal - Mihedge Bi) 
B = ∑ind wind * Mind * Bind
C = ∑i 0.75 * wi2 * (Mi * EADitotal - MihedgeBi)2

h is the one-year risk horizon, in units of a year, h = 1.
wi is the weight applicable to counterparty based on its external rating
EADitotal is the exposure at default of counterparty ‘i’, aggregated across all relevant netting sets, including the effect of any relevant collateral after applying the discount factor: (1 - exp(-0.05*Mi))/(0.05*Mi)
Bi is the notional amount of purchased single name CDS hedges, which notional amounts shall be aggregated in the case of more than one position referencing counterparty ‘i’, and used to hedge the bank’s exposure to CVA risk after applying the discount factor: (1 - exp(-0.05*Mihedge))/(0.05* Mihedge)
Mi is the effective maturity of the relevant transactions with counterparty i. For the purposes of this calculation the effective maturity is not capped at 5 years. However, a floor of 1 year is applied to all effective maturities less than one year.
Mihedge is the maturity of the hedge instrument with notional Bi, provided that in the case of several positions the bank shall aggregate the relevant quantities Mihedge∙Bi
Mind is the maturity of the index hedge, provided that in the case of more than one index hedge position, it shall be the relevant notional weighted average maturity.

entity.description: The Credit Valuation Adjustment (CVA) Capital Charge is a special provision for capitalising for losses resulting from CVA volatility. Based on 1 in 1000 Confidence Interval
entity.label: Term
entity.name: Economic Capital Credit Valuation Adjustment

properties.value: RB Credit Risk|ARO Credit Risk|Credit Risk|Retail Credit Risk
The Credit Valuation Adjustment (CVA) Capital Charge is a special provision for capitalising for losses resulting from CVA volatility. Based on 1 in 1000 Confidence Interval

Formula
CVA 1 in 1000 = CVA x 8% x Scalar

Code
CASE WHEN CVA > 0 THEN CVA / 1000000 * 0.08 * Scalar_10 ELSE 0 END

A regulatory measure of a bank’s assets adjusted for their associated risk. Equity investment risk refers to the risk of adverse changes in the value of listed and unlisted equity investments. These investments are longer-term investments held in the banking book for non-trading purposes. Equity investment risk includes investments held for both capital gains and strategic purposes comprising of private equity investments, infrastructure equity investments and commercial property equity investments per Banks Act BA34 definition of investments conveying the economic substance of equity ownership.

entity.description: Earnings at Risk i s the variation in the income statement, specifically Net Interest Income (NII), as a result in movements in interest rate measures the sensitivity of net interest income (NII) to the changes of interest rates over the next 12 months.The Calculation takes the base implied forward spot(Base Rate), calculates NII, then shocks this by 100 and 200 bp.The calculation takes the difference between the base and the shock.Components that make up the metric are Book Value, Client Rate, Payment Frequency, Sub Product Code, Start Date, End Date, Rate index, Rate type, Business Date.

Economic capital (EC) is an estimate of the maximum downward deviation from expectation in shareholder value, measured on an economic basis over a one year time horizon and at a specified confidence interval.
Absa Group Limited, Absa Bank Limited, Absa Bank Solo

EC is a function of:

Daily VaR scaled by an Economic Capital Multiplier (ECM)

The traded market risk economic capital multiplier (ECM) was derived from a Monte Carlo simulation using 100 000 replications.The ECM is the ratio of the 99,95% one-year loss to the 95% one-day loss (DVaR).A similar derivation was done for ECM at a 99,90% confidence level.

entity.description: The Net open Position is the sum of all settled foreign currency cash and PV of all future foreign currency cash flows. The Net open Position is calculated using the FX TPL Cash, i.e. FX TPL Cash = FX Cash (All settled foreign currency cash) and the PV of FX (PV of all future foreign currency cash flows). In FA it is defined as the equivalent cash positions, that is, a cash position with the same profit and loss and FX risk as the original position and thus providing the FX hedge amounts.

properties.value: The Net open Position is the sum of all settled foreign currency cash and PV of all future foreign currency cash flows. The Net open Position is calculated using the FX TPL Cash, i.e. FX TPL Cash = FX Cash (All settled foreign currency cash) and the PV of FX (PV of all future foreign currency cash flows). In FA it is defined as the equivalent cash positions, that is, a cash position with the same profit and loss and FX risk as the original position and thus providing the FX hedge amounts.
